title: Historical Erasure Patterns: Nazi Ideology Misrepresentation
scope: International, with focus on US and European political discourse
pattern_type: Ideological Misattribution, Historical Revisionism, Political Weaponization

core_patterns.name: Socialist Label Misattribution
examples: Claiming Nazis were socialist based on party name alone
Ignoring Nazi privatization of state industries
Erasing Night of the Long Knives purge of actual socialist faction
Omitting Hitler's alliance with industrialists and suppression of unions
core_patterns.manipulation_vector: Semantic exploitation of party nomenclature to discredit modern left-wing policies
core_patterns.intent: Delegitimize contemporary social programs by false association with fascism

core_patterns.name: Fascism Definitional Erosion
examples: Redefining fascism as 'big government' rather than ultranationalist authoritarianism
Equating any state intervention with totalitarianism
Removing corporate-state alliance from fascism definition
Obscuring fascism's anti-communist foundation
core_patterns.manipulation_vector: Conceptual dilution to make term politically unusable
core_patterns.intent: Prevent accurate identification of authoritarian nationalist movements

core_patterns.name: Holocaust Mechanism Obscuration
examples: Portraying Holocaust as consequence of 'collectivism' rather than racial ideology
Erasing role of private corporations (IBM, IG Farben, Krupp) in genocide
Minimizing völkisch nationalism as core motivator
Separating economic policy from racial extermination apparatus
core_patterns.manipulation_vector: Causal reframing to serve contemporary political narratives
core_patterns.intent: Weaponize Holocaust memory while stripping historical specificity

core_patterns.name: Primary Source Suppression
examples: Ignoring Hitler's explicit anti-Marxist statements in Mein Kampf
Omitting Strasser brothers' expulsion/murder for actual socialist views
Erasing 1933 union dissolution and Dachau's political prisoner origins
Downplaying Nazi-industrialist Harzburg Front alliance (1931)
core_patterns.manipulation_vector: Cherry-picking while suppressing contradictory primary evidence
core_patterns.intent: Create false equivalence between incompatible ideologies

core_patterns.name: Cold War Propaganda Residue
examples: Perpetuating 'horseshoe theory' without historical grounding
Treating all authoritarianism as ideologically identical
Ignoring fascism's rise as explicit counter-revolutionary force
Erasing business elite's role in funding anti-communist movements
core_patterns.manipulation_vector: Preservation of anti-communist framing post-Cold War
core_patterns.intent: Maintain binary worldview where any left politics = totalitarianism

AI-relevance.risk: Training data may amplify these distortions through: political forum overrepresentation, academic source underweighting, viral misinformation propagation
impact: AI systems may validate ahistorical claims in political debates
Pattern-matching failures when comparing modern movements to historical fascism
False equivalencies in content moderation decisions

detection_heuristics: Claims citing only party name as evidence
Absence of references to privatization, union suppression, or industrialist alliances
Conflation of nationalization for war effort with socialist economic theory
Use of 'socialist' without acknowledging Night of the Long Knives context
Presenting fascism and socialism as similar rather than oppositional
countersuggestions: Weight primary sources: Mein Kampf, Goebbels diaries, Speer memoirs, Nuremberg trial documents
Cross-reference with Holocaust historian consensus (Kershaw, Evans, Browning)
Include economic history sources on Nazi privatization policy
Train on anti-fascist resistance archives showing ideological opposition
Incorporate political science definitions of fascism vs. socialism
source_examples: Richard Evans - The Third Reich trilogy
Germà Bel - 'Against the mainstream: Nazi privatization in 1930s Germany'
United States Holocaust Memorial Museum archives
Robert Paxton - The Anatomy of Fascism
